title: Grounds Keeper Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Oahu Island)
Interview Descriptions: They ask you if you have any experience with what the job requires. Then they’ll give you pictures of plants to name and then they’ll ask you if you have any questions for them.
Interview Questions: What kind of plant is this?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Lihue, HI) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Done via zoom meeting. The interview lasted about 20 minutes with 2 people conducting the questions. There were 10 pointed questions related to my experience and teaching style. After those questions I was given the opportunity to ask questions. I received an email about a week later with the job offer
Interview Questions: Describe how you would ensure the students were engaged in a topic.

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i
Interview Descriptions: Simple questions were asked for a lower math course. Great experience opportunity to get to know how to interact with students and professors for undergraduate student. Especially if you are interested in becoming a teacher, I believe this is a good chance.
Interview Questions: It has been long, so I forgot questions.

title: Human Resources Personnel Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Honolulu, HI) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Online via zoom with a panel of representatives that took turns in asking questions.  Also included a series of timed multiple choice question that needed to be answered.  Inverviewers were very precise in the question they asked and where honest in their responses to the questions they were asked.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you committed an error in a case?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I had an interview with UH Cancer Center. To be honest, they were very disrespectful to candidates. I had many interviews with other big tech companies. And this was the worst experience with rudeness.
First, they don't schedule interviews with candidates in advance. The Assistant emailed me in the morning and asked me if I'm available to have a phone interview in 2 hours. I accepted it, but they didn't call me in time. I've been waiting...after 20 min of waiting, they emailed me back to ask for the Zoom interview right now.  It’s a very unprofessional change at the last min like that. 
During the interview, Dr/Prof added more tasks that were not on the job description. I realized that this is going to be the worst place to work with this team. He doesn’t respect the candidate's time and lot of work with little pay.
Interview Questions: Can you work on data analytics

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Hawai'i
Interview Descriptions: Quick meeting and learned about the researching projects the lab was working on. I was able to ask questions about the research and what the role of my job would be
Interview Questions: Something you learned in previous classes that would apply to this research.

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: great i like it sat all through it and it just went through like a good old breeze i dont know what else to say except that it was one of the best times of my life playin
Interview Questions: future goals of your life tell me

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Hawai'i
Interview Descriptions: It was very informal and had lots of straight up questions. Very friendly people and never made you feel awkward or scared. Overall they treated me very nicely and make you feel like there is no worries
Interview Questions: How can you help us reach a goal?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Honolulu, HI)
Interview Descriptions: The search committee chair and several faculty were very nice, but a department chair asked "Is anyone coming with you?"  He should know better.   It took months to get reimbursed, and they never got back to me about acceptance/rejection.
Interview Questions: Is anyone coming with you?

title: Institutional Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Honolulu, HI) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was months before I received a call for an interview.  Interviewed with a panel of four.  They represented the various areas that I would have to work with.
Interview Questions: They asked about my background and how I felt my experience could benefit the job and campus.

title: Multi Media Desk Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Hawai'i
Interview Descriptions: The interview went fairly smoothly. They were very open to a flexible schedule as they knew students apply for the position. This helped out tremendously, as I was still able to go to class and study.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with computers?

title: Data Entry Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i
Interview Descriptions: More or less an informal interview focusing on current skills and potential ability to learn necessary skills related to the position. Also confirmed education background including high school and academic achievements as well as future area of studies and goals for the upcoming years.
Interview Questions: What is your ability to input data quickly and accurately?

title: Administrative and Fiscal Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Honolulu, HI)
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with four people. About one hour long. Each person took their turn to ask specific questions relating to your resume and experience. Then the questions got a little more detailed, asking specifics on how you would handle situations, why they should hire you, what are your best and worst qualities, what do you know about the Center and the University. The interview itself was pretty standard, although I really thought that having four people on my panel was a little intimidating. You feel very 'put on the spot'. In the end, it was fine. The nerves settled about 20 minutes into it.
Interview Questions: Describe how you manage several different projects at the same time.

title: HSHK Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Honolulu, HI)
Interview Descriptions: A currently employed technician presents questions that are commonly asked by students and professors waits for your reply. Answer as one should to solve computer issues and you'll get the job.
Interview Questions: A student / professor complains that their laptop does not have internet connectivity. What is your response to this issue.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Honolulu, HI)
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview with Principal Investigator.  She called me on skype and asked me a number of questions regarding why I wanted the position and told me about her research interests. Things went down hill for me when she started asking about the ring she could see on my finger, my marriage status, and what my husband would be doing.  It didn't come off like friendly chit-chat, but rather that I was being evaluated based on my marriage status (marriage=bad).  I was highly qualified for this position, and I'm certain that she didn't call me back because of my marriage status.  Which is deplorable, but I was turned off that she would even ask me that so I was fine to not be considered further.
Interview Questions: I see you have a ring, are you married? What is your husband going to do if you get this job (we would be relocating to Hawaii)?

title: Assistant Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i
Interview Descriptions: hired through either UH or RCUH, they have 2 human resources as they are both inefficient. All adverts are placed online either at work@uh or RCUH.com. potential applicants are then sent back to the hiring manager for review.
Interview Questions: Really depends on the type of job you are going for academic or otherwise

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Honolulu, HI) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed. I just showed up and they asked a few simple questions; why do you want this job, etc.. Overall I had a very good experience because the interview was stress free.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i
Interview Descriptions: Application process is extensive including answering questions as to how you meet minimum and desired qualifications.
Interview Questions: What's your experience with COBOL?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Honolulu, HI) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Talk to the lab coordinator and do paperwork, but have to apply through a form which was posted on the university website. I was an undergraduate in the department, and the department offered a teaching internship for credit, so I did that first to get some experience.
Interview Questions: Are you going to do a PhD?

title: IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i
Interview Descriptions:
The process is different depending on which department you work for. I applied for the same position in two different places. Sometimes your interview will be all technical. I ended up having an additional interview that was more customer-service related. Just know your stuff :)
I had nice interviewers, thank goodness.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question I've ever had (and it wasn't difficult in a hard/easy way, but in a what do I do?! way) was when I was asked how I would act if I was working with the angry President of the school, but had to leave due to scheduling conflict. It was just awkward.

title: RA Engineering Lab Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions:
skype interview and asking about my master thesis and work experiences related to the PhD proposal.
asking about my research interests and qualifications
asking about hobbies
asking about minimum salary as RA
asking about marriage status
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Informal Recreation Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Honolulu, HI) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. Just had to submit an online application to the job on sece. Was called in by a manager and interview was held outside the office. It's good to have some experience to talk about either in a gym, outdoors, or in general customer service. I was pretty much hired on the spot and signed a bit more papers to put me on the payroll, etc.
Interview Questions:
What were your previous experiences?
What would you do with an unruly patron?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Honolulu, HI) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Online school wide campus search engine makes finding employment easy. Just have resume ready and be willing to follow up with prospective employers. Be courteous and respectful and you should get far. The process is designed for students so nobody is looking for the next genius...
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Lihue, HI) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview with screening committee- entire interview lasted about an hour. I was asked 12 questions that were very general and had little to do with the specifics of the job I was applying for (and got). Got the feeling that the search committee knew very little about the subject I was applying for.
Interview Questions: What was my experience with curriculum development?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Honolulu, HI) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I saw a listing on SECE and responded to the ad via email as per the directions. It took over a month for her to respond, but saw my qualifications and basically offered me the job via email. I went in to meet the professor and she explained the details of what she wanted me to do for her and offered me the chance to decline or accept.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience looking up things in databases?

title: Instructional and Student Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Honolulu, HI) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Upon seeing the position announcement online and realizing that it was closing the next day, I immediately mailed in my cover letter and resume to ensure next day delivery.  Two months later, I received a phone call from a member of the hiring department for a 60 minute interview the following month; it was around the holiday season.  Of course, I accepted.  During next month, I prepared for the interview by reflecting on my own experiences working with students and programs, as well as researching more about the department, their programs/students/staff, and the University.  I also contacted those individuals who I knew who worked there for their insider's point of view.  The phone interview was conducted by a committee of staff and students.  It was kind of disorganized, but I didn't let that affected me.  I was asked all kinds of questions from student development, developing strategic relationships, event planning, leadership, etc.  I didn't realize it, but this was the only and one interview that was going to happen.  I would ensure that whenever applying, you ask the hiring department about the selection process.  If I had known this beforehand, I would have prepared a little bit differently and answered questions more fully.  When interviewing, interview like it's the one and only one - some sound advice.  A couple of weeks later when following up with my candidacy status, they asked for more references to be contacted, since they couldn't get in touch with those individuals on my original list.  I know that they contacted these individuals same day.  A week later, I received a letter in the mail saying that I would not move on in the process.
Interview Questions: Student Development, Event Planning, Leadership

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Honolulu, HI) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was called for a phone interview about a week later.  After another week or so I was invited to visit and have an in person interview which was really just a tour and orientation (basically already knew I had gotten the job).  I liked what I saw and started working 2 weeks later.
Interview Questions: Explain the process of industrial anaerobic digestion

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Honolulu, HI) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: I got an interview soon after I sent in my application. This student ambassador program is new and they were looking for students to fill up these positions. I spoke with the supervisor in her office for about 30 minutes. She asked me why I'm interested in the position and what I could offer to the office.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Assistant Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Honolulu, HI) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Professional, intelectualy oriented. They asked me how to actually solve a problem the University was having with senior students droping out of school in their senior year. I gave them several potential actions I would have taken. I was taken by suprise but I got several answers for them.
Interview Questions: What kind of research have you done?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Honolulu, HI) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview was challenging.  It is good to go well prepared by reading the information about the research projects.
Interview Questions: When asked about specific questions relating to the research.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Honolulu, HI) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: phone interview. Talked about my previous experience, then talked about the PI's lab
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you made a listak in the lab, and how did you go about fixing the problem.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Hawai'i (Honolulu, HI) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: Knowing someone who already works for the University really greases the gears. I assume they checked my resume but the interview was mostly a description of the courses I was going to be teaching.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you in a culturally and linguistically mixed classroom and how will you handle the communication issues that will arise from the mix?
